description: From Latin apprehensīvus, from apprehensus, perfect passive participle of apprehendō (“to apprehend, understand, learn”) + -īvus (“-ive”).

adjectives.description: apprehensive (comparative more apprehensive, superlative most apprehensive)

entries.meaning: Anticipating something with anxiety, fear, or doubt; reluctant.
(obsolete) Perceptive; quick to learn; capable of understanding using one's intellect.
examples: More fond of Miracles, than apprehensive of Truth.
